comments.text:
"The new version sucked, so I downgraded, and it forced the new version on me again!"

Manually downgrading the app (without switching update channels) should change the update pref from "automatically install" to "let me choose", so we don't immediately override the user's choice.

comments.text:
If this is implemented there definitely should be UI that informs the user of this.

Also, app update doesn't typically load during startup to lessen the time to start the application. Applications typically already checks if the application version has changed during startup (Firefox definitely does) so it would likely be better for the application to change this behavior. With both of the above in mind I think this should be implemented in Firefox and not toolkit -> app update.
